intro: Lisianthius caerulescens, commonly known as the blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 2 to 3 feet, featuring narrow, grass-like leaves and clusters of blue to purple flowers. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil, making it a suitable choice for gardens and natural landscapes. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its long blooming period, which extends from late spring through early fall.
